required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: LVIS® Evo™ and HydroCoil® Embolic System for Intracranial Aneurysm Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Effectiveness Analysis of Stent Assisted Coiling With LVIS® Evo™ and HydroCoil® Embolic System in Aneurysm Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective multicenter international single-arm observational study to demonstrate that use of stent-assisted coiling with LVIS® Evo™ and HydroCoil® Embolic System (HES) in intracranial aneurysm treatment is effective and safe when assessed at 1 year after the procedure

detailed_description.textblock:
Patient treatment and follow-up will be performed as per standard of care. The study will evaluate the proportion of aneurysms with complete occlusion based on Raymond-Roy occlusion classification (RROC) at 12 ± 6-months, as well as other effectiveness and safety endpoints such as the occurence of stent stenosis or parent artery occlusion, the occurence of retreatment and recanalization, the rate of major ipsilateral stroke or neurological death, the proportion of patients with good functional clinical outcome, the occurence of SAH, aneurysm rupture, procedural complications, serious adverse events...
Sample size: 200 patients

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of aneurysms with complete occlusion
primary_outcome.description: based on Raymond-Roy occlusion classification (RROC) evaluated by an independent Core laboratory using digital subtraction angiograms (DSA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of aneurysms with Raymond-Roy Occlusion Class I, II or III, and Modified Raymond-Roy Classification at immediate post procedure and each follow-up visits
secondary_outcome.description: Raymond Roy Classification and Modified Raymond-Roy Classification evaluated by an independent Core laboratory

secondary_outcome.measure: RROC shift between immediate post procedure and each follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: based on Raymond Roy Classification evaluated by an independent Core laboratory

secondary_outcome.measure: Aneurysm occlusion stability between immediate post procedure and each follow-up visit
secondary_outcome.description: stable, improved, or worsened evaluated by an independent Core laboratory

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of aneurysms with stent successful deployment at the target aneurysm neck
secondary_outcome.description: evaluated by an independent Core laboratory

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of HES coil length implanted in the target aneurysm
secondary_outcome.description: HES coil length on the total coil length used

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of aneurysms with complete stent apposition
secondary_outcome.description: evaluated by an independent Core laboratory

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of in-stent stenosis or parent artery occlusion at each follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: evaluated by an independent Core laboratory

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of target aneurysm recanalization at each follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Aneurysm occlusion deterioration evaluated by an independent Core laboratory

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of target aneurysm retreatment at each follow-up
Major ipsilateral stroke or neurological death within 12 months and 30 months
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by an independent clinical event committee

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with good functional clinical outcomes
secondary_outcome.description: a good functional outcome is defined by an mRS between 0 and 2, or an mRS equal to baseline if it was > 2 at baseline, with mRS is the modified Rankin Scale (a neurological score from 0: no deficit to 6: death)
assessed by an independent clinical event committee
assessed by an independent clinical event committee

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of device-related serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by an independent clinical event committee
assessed by an independent clinical event committee
assessed by an independent clinical event committee

intervention.intervention_name: LVIS EVO and HydroCoil Embolic System

study_pop.textblock: Patients presenting with an unruptured or ruptured (> 30 days since occurrence) intracranial aneurysm eligible for endovascular treatment using LVIS® Evo™ and HydroCoil® Embolic System (HES)
